patterns: Is any document/guide available for CCI ?
What are the uses of CCI ?
responses:
The key goal of CCI is to enable consumers to access metadata/data provided by any AppSDK based connectors (s) using a consistent, generic and stable API based interface. CCI makes it convenient to enable support for any existing as well as new AppSDK based connectors without any significant impact on the consumer. Also, the connectors need to be built only once and can be deployed in any product that supports CCI based apis resulting in reduced engineering and maintenance costs. 
 For further info visit https://infawiki.informatica.com/display/CON/CCI+-+Onboarding

patterns: Does CCI allows Postman Calls  via REST?
CCI REST exposes API for Consumers ?
Can you help me with REST API's of CCI ?
responses:
CCI Provides REST API's. These REST API's will be called from SaaS UI. CCI REST API's could be called in StandAlone Mode as well. 
 For Further Information visit https://infawiki.informatica.com/display/CON/CCI+Rest+API

tag: StandAlone Mode | Tomcat | Deployment in web server
patterns: How can i use CCI in StandAlone Mode ?
How to Deploy CCI in Tomcat ?
responses: CCI.war could be deployed in Tomcat as well. In StandAlone Mode, CCI.war will be deployed in tomcat and Any REST Client (Postman) could be used to access CCI REST API's. For Further Information visit https://infawiki.informatica.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=260407702

tag: Metadata Debugging | How to Set JRE_OPTS for Debugging | Debug Metadata in Eclipse
patterns: Please provide JVM arg for Metadata Debugging
responses:
TOMCAT JRE_OPTS '-Xrs -Xdebug -Xrunjdwp:transport=dt_socket,address=7882,server=y,suspend=n' 
 Any Free Port could also be used 
 For Further Details Visit https://infawiki.informatica.com/display/CON/Different+Flags+introduced+by+CCI

tag: Runtime Process Debugging | Debug DTM Process | Runtime Debugging in Eclipse

 Any Free Port could also be used 
 For Further Details Visit https://infawiki.informatica.com/display/CON/Different+Flags+introduced+by+CCI

Which Parameters are used to pass values to the Procedure?
responses:
Stored Procedures are created to perform one or more DML operations on Database. It is nothing but the group of SQL statements that accepts some input in the form of parameters and performs some task and may or may not returns a value. 
 Parameters are used to pass values to the Procedure. There are 4 different types of parameters, they are IN, OUT, IN OUT, RETURN TYPE 
 Refer https://infawiki.informatica.com/display/CON/Stored+Procedure+in+CCI+connectors for further details

patterns: which are Query modes in SQL Tx?
responses:
When an SQL transformation runs in query mode, it executes an SQL query that you define in the transformation. You pass strings or parameters to the query from the transformation input ports to change the query statement or the query data. 
 When you configure the SQL transformation to run in query mode, you create an active transformation. The transformation can return multiple rows for each input row. 
 Type the query statement in the SQL Editor main window. The SQL Editor provides a list of the transformation ports that you can reference in the query. You can double-click a port name to add it as a query parameter. So the incoming port can be used as a parameter in your query.
The outgoing port have to be added manually, where the user will be required to give the respective native type as well.
Query mode PC documentation : 
 https://docs.informatica.com/data-integration/powercenter/10-2/transformation-guide/sql-transformation/query-mode.html

patterns: What is purpose of passthrough port ?
responses: Any incoming port can be marked  for pass through, and we need to make sure that this port does not get overwritten with any other data. The outgoing passthrough port should have the same data as it had when it was incoming port. For Further details refer https://infawiki.informatica.com/display/CON/SQL+Tx+-+Adhoc+query+in+CDI
